verses.verse: For<WG1063> this<WG3778> Melchisedec<WG3198>, king<WG935> of Salem<WG4532>, priest<WG2409> of the most high<WG5310> God<WG2316>, who<WG3588> met<WG4876> Abraham<WG11> returning<WG5290> from<WG575> the slaughter<WG2871> of the kings<WG935>, and<WG2532> blessed<WG2127> him<WG846>;

To whom<WG3739> also<WG2532> Abraham<WG11> gave<WG3307> a tenth part<WG1181> of<WG575> all<WG3956>; first<WG4412><WG3303> being by interpretation<WG2059> King<WG935> of righteousness<WG1343>, and<WG1161> after that<WG1899> also<WG2532> King<WG935> of Salem<WG4532>, which is<WG3603>, King<WG935> of peace<WG1515>;

Without father<WG540>, without mother<WG282>, without descent<WG35>, having<WG2192> neither<WG3383> beginning<WG746> of days<WG2250>, nor<WG3383> end<WG5056> of life<WG2222>; but<WG1161> made like<WG871> unto the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316>; abideth<WG3306> a priest<WG2409> continually<WG1519><WG1336>.
Now<WG1161> consider<WG2334> how great<WG4080> this man<WG3778> was, unto whom<WG3739> even<WG2532> the patriarch<WG3966> Abraham<WG11> gave<WG1325> the tenth<WG1181> of<WG1537> the spoils<WG205>.

And<WG2532> verily<WG3303> they that are of<WG1537> the sons<WG5207> of Levi<WG3017>, who<WG3588> receive<WG2983> the office of the priesthood<WG2405>, have<WG2192> a commandment<WG1785> to take tithes<WG586> of the people<WG2992> according to<WG2596> the law<WG3551>, that is<WG5123>, of their<WG846> brethren<WG80>, though<WG2539> they come<WG1831> out of<WG1537> the loins<WG3751> of Abraham<WG11>:

But<WG1161> he whose descent is<WG1075> not<WG3361> counted<WG1075> from<WG1537> them<WG846> received tithes<WG1183> of Abraham<WG11>, and<WG2532> blessed<WG2127> him that had<WG2192> the promises<WG1860>.
And<WG1161> without<WG5565> all<WG3956> contradiction<WG485> the less<WG1640> is blessed<WG2127> of<WG5259> the better<WG2909>.

And<WG2532> here<WG5602><WG3303> men<WG444> that die<WG599> receive<WG2983> tithes<WG1181>; but<WG1161> there<WG1563> he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed<WG3140> that<WG3754> he liveth<WG2198>.
And<WG2532> as<WG5613> I may so say<WG2031><WG2036>, Levi<WG3017> also<WG2532>, who<WG3588> receiveth<WG2983> tithes<WG1181>, payed tithes<WG1183> in<WG1223> Abraham<WG11>.
For<WG1063> he was<WG2258> yet<WG2089> in<WG1722> the loins<WG3751> of his father<WG3962>, when<WG3753> Melchisedec<WG3198> met<WG4876> him<WG846>.

If<WG1487><WG3303> therefore<WG3767> perfection<WG5050> were<WG2258> by<WG1223> the Levitical<WG3020> priesthood<WG2420>, (for<WG1063> under<WG1909> it<WG846> the people<WG2992> received the law<WG3549>,) what<WG5101> further<WG2089> need<WG5532> was there that another<WG2087> priest<WG2409> should rise<WG450> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Melchisedec<WG3198>, and<WG2532> not<WG3756> be called<WG3004> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Aaron<WG2>?
For<WG1063> the priesthood<WG2420> being changed<WG3346>, there is made<WG1096> of<WG1537> necessity<WG318> a change<WG3331> also<WG2532> of the law<WG3551>.

For<WG1063> he of<WG1909> whom<WG3739> these things<WG5023> are spoken<WG3004> pertaineth<WG3348> to another<WG2087> tribe<WG5443>, of<WG575> which<WG3739> no man<WG3762> gave attendance<WG4337> at the altar<WG2379>.

For<WG1063> it is evident<WG4271> that<WG3754> our<WG2257> Lord<WG2962> sprang<WG393> out of<WG1537> Juda<WG2455>; of<WG1519> which<WG3739> tribe<WG5443> Moses<WG3475> spake<WG2980> nothing<WG3762> concerning<WG4012> priesthood<WG2420>.

And<WG2532> it is<WG2076> yet<WG2089> far more<WG4054> evident<WG2612>: for<WG1487> that after<WG2596> the similitude<WG3665> of Melchisedec<WG3198> there ariseth<WG450> another<WG2087> priest<WG2409>,
Who<WG3739> is made<WG1096>, not<WG3756> after<WG2596> the law<WG3551> of a carnal<WG4559> commandment<WG1785>, but<WG235> after<WG2596> the power<WG1411> of an endless<WG179> life<WG2222>.
For<WG1063> he testifieth<WG3140><WG3754>, Thou<WG4771> art a priest<WG2409> for<WG1519> ever<WG165> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Melchisedec<WG3198>.
For<WG1063> there is<WG1096> verily<WG3303> a disannulling<WG115> of the commandment<WG1785> going before<WG4254> for<WG1223> the weakness<WG772> and<WG2532> unprofitableness<WG512> thereof<WG846>.

For<WG1063> the law<WG3551> made<WG5048> nothing<WG3762> perfect<WG5048>, but<WG1161> the bringing in<WG1898> of a better<WG2909> hope<WG1680> did; by<WG1223> the which<WG3739> we draw nigh<WG1448> unto God<WG2316>.
And<WG2532> inasmuch as<WG2596><WG3745> not<WG3756> without<WG5565> an oath<WG3728> he was made priest:

(For<WG1063> those priests<WG2409> were<WG3303><WG1526> made<WG1096> without<WG5565> an oath<WG3728>; but<WG1161> this with<WG3326> an oath<WG3728> by<WG1223> him that said<WG3004> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>, The Lord<WG2962> sware<WG3660> and<WG2532> will<WG3338> not<WG3756> repent<WG3338>, Thou<WG4771> art a priest<WG2409> for<WG1519> ever<WG165> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Melchisedec<WG3198>: )
By<WG2596> so much<WG5118> was<WG1096> Jesus<WG2424> made<WG1096> a surety<WG1450> of a better<WG2909> testament<WG1242>.
And<WG2532> they<WG1526> truly<WG3303> were<WG1526><WG1096> many<WG4119> priests<WG2409>, because they were not suffered<WG2967> to continue<WG3887> by reason of<WG1223> death<WG2288>:
But<WG1161> this man, because<WG1223> he<WG846> continueth<WG3306> ever<WG1519><WG165>, hath<WG2192> an unchangeable<WG531> priesthood<WG2420>.

Wherefore<WG3606> he is able<WG1410> also<WG2532> to save them<WG4982> to<WG1519> the uttermost<WG3838> that come<WG4334> unto God<WG2316> by<WG1223> him<WG846>, seeing he ever<WG3842> liveth<WG2198> to<WG1519> make intercession<WG1793> for<WG5228> them<WG846>.

For<WG1063> such<WG5108> an high priest<WG749> became<WG4241> us<WG2254>, who is holy<WG3741>, harmless<WG172>, undefiled<WG283>, separate<WG5563> from<WG575> sinners<WG268>, and<WG2532> made<WG1096> higher than<WG5308> the heavens<WG3772>;

Who<WG3739> needeth<WG2192><WG318> not<WG3756> daily<WG2596><WG2250>, as<WG5618> those high priests<WG749>, to offer up<WG399> sacrifice<WG2378>, first<WG4386> for<WG5228> his own<WG2398> sins<WG266>, and then<WG1899> for the people's<WG2992>: for<WG1063> this<WG5124> he did<WG4160> once<WG2178>, when he offered up<WG399> himself<WG1438>.

For<WG1063> the law<WG3551> maketh<WG2525> men<WG444> high priests<WG749> which have<WG2192> infirmity<WG769>; but<WG1161> the word<WG3056> of the oath<WG3728>, which<WG3588> was since<WG3326> the law<WG3551>, maketh the Son<WG5207>, who is consecrated<WG5048> for<WG1519> evermore<WG165>.
